PIONEER EXPERIENCES

A word of explanation to the person answering the questionnaire.

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires which have been prepared or projected are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Office of the Saskatchewan Archives at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

My stepfather (my father) homesteaded and built a little cabin, my brothers took a homestead claim 50 miles east. We moved into town when they grew up and bought land.

We built our own cabin and got land and moved into town. We had a hard time getting started but we worked hard and saved money. We bought cattle and planted crops.

We walked to church with a team and plow. It was almost 20 miles. We had to go down road first for water, then back to town for grain and milk, which was 6 miles. Church was about 7 miles.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

My son, John (my oldest) homesteaded and a little later, my brother took a homestead almost 50 miles west of here. The two men were young and when they grew up they went out on their own. My old man went back and bought some cattle and got land and we moved our herd there. We built a house and a barn for them. We lived there for a few years and then moved to New Castle and stayed there until we moved to Illinois.

We went to church once a month, which was about 7 miles.

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (For business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

My stepfather (my father) homesteaded and a little later my brother took a homestead almost 50 miles east of him. The others went to yours and when they grew up they moved to BC.

My little sister was born in 1918 and we moved to BC in 1920. We had a cow and a pig and a few chickens. We raised our own vegetables and some fruit. We also had a garden. We had a small house and a barn. We lived in a dugout for a while, which was almost 20 miles from the town.
